::Suka::

"Yes, Mr President," Suka replies after completing his last assignment, quickly getting together 75 armed soldiers and posting them around the perimiter, giving them their orders.





--- In nbwrpg@y..., KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> President Kaiser/Sequencer/Sinew/Captain Nemo:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Kaiser  watched on the large viewscreen of the bridge as the mighty Otyebis 
> descended through the thick clouds towards the cleared area of what would be 
> known as Seattle, the most important city in the U.S.A. state Washington.  
> 
> "Status report?" Nemo asked as he sat in his command chair, the feathery 
> captain of the vessel not in the least nervous, the landing of the Otyebis 
> being a common exercise.
> 
> "Descending at a velocity of fifty MPH and slowly dropping.  All systems at 
> are 100%, scans report no Cybertronian units in the vicinity." some bridge 
> officer replied.
> 
> "Good," Kaiser said with a nod, activating his personal comm. unit, 
> "Vice-President Suka prepare a garrison of seventy-five lightly armed peoples 
> and after we have landed erect a perimeter guard a hundred feet out of the 
> firing range of the Otyebis' defenses."
> 
> The viewscreen displayed the greenish burnt ground below the Otyebis where 
> the ship was destined to land, the ground appearing to get closer very 
> rapidly.  
> 
> "Hold onto something." Nemo ordered, everyone present on the bridge doing as 
> he said as the Otyebis' main thrusters burst to life and lightly shook the 
> ship, no warning given to anyone that was outside of the bridge.  The flames 
> burnt into the ground several hundred feet below the Otyebis and slowed the 
> ships descent even more, the city-sized craft softly touching to the ground 
> with a light jolt that wouldn't even knock over a few month old infant.  
> "Congratulations everyone on a successful landing."
> 
> "Yes, but we're not done yet.  Sinew, I want full reports from all sections 
> of the craft on their condition.  Sequencer, send out the welcoming 
> transmission when Suka's perimeter guard is set up.  I also want reserve 
> troops pulled, this is a volatile world with many different fanatical 
> factions and I don't want anything messed up.  We have over five hundred 
> thousand civilians on board eager for the games, and when the satellites are 
> sent up hundreds of billions of lifeforms will be watching from their homes."
